dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE sits at his desk, feet up, drinking coffee and reading a book between sips. A small television keeps him company from a chair in the corner of the room. Through the --

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: -- headlights approach, and light up the driveway and gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Steve glances at the ever-worsening picture on the television, the same headlights light up his work station. Annoyed, he switches off the television and walks to the window. The sound of TRUCK DOORS OPENING, and the CRUNCH OF FOOTSTEPS on gravel. Steve squints from the bright headlights, trying to make out who it is. He shades his eyes, and peers closer. The distinctive, but muted, sound of a METAL GATE being SHAKEN. Steve grabs his flashlight and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large removal truck is parked and two young men: BEN and TREVOR (20s) hover beside the gate.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Cemetery closed at six.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we know. Ben reaches over, pulls at the lock, and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we come in?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Open the gate. Ben slowly coils his fingers around the bars.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Come on Steve. Open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: How do you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Steve, we don't have much time. Come closer. He glares at Steve. Steve takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Let us in, okay? Steve unlocks and opens the gate.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: That's a good man. Pete grabs Steve by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I have someone that would like to meet you. They lead Steve to the rear of the truck, push him inside, and SLAM the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, six shadowy figures slowly close in on Steve. As he backs himself up against the wall, a lone figure moves in. SteveвЂ™s SCREAMS are drowned out as the truck RUMBLES to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep within the dark cemetery, the truck stops beside a lone grave site.  3. The rear doors open, five MEN get out with pick-axes and shovels, and begin to dig. A shovel swoops down and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling mass of steel and glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young woman, JAMI (22), puts on her clothes. MARK (25), stirs next to her, half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: You know, unless it's a one night stand, leaving before the other half wakes up could be considered rude.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s Monday.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Already? Sorry hun. Do you want me to come with you? I kind of get the feeling you don't want me to meet your Mother. She playfully punches him in the arm. Frenzied CLAWING SOUNDS come from somewhere near the front door. Mark zips out into the --

dialogues.speaker: SMALL HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CALVIN, a totally freaked-out little Boxer, desperately tries to scratch his way out.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Calvin! Stop that! Mark swats his rump. Calvin continues clawing.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: As Mark reaches down to pull him away from the door, Calvin stops scratching, and GROWLS very softly.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Cal? Calvin frantically claws at the door again. Mark quickly unbolts the door, and Calvin runs off. Jami appears behind Mark.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's never done that before.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Must have a hot date! Jami looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Okay, you have five minutes to get dressed if you want to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Yes... But hurry, before I change my mind.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Do I need to wear anything special?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mark, she's been dead for a year now. She won't mind what you wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits next to Jami in her van, as she slowly drives through the cemetery. He yawns, still not fully awake yet.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I wonder where Steve is.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Maybe he's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Probably. Let's not keep Mum waiting. As they drive through the cemetery, the scenery becomes dominated by huge trees and bright green grass. They both turn and check out the gravestones they pass. Jami casually turns back to face the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Shit! Jami slams on the breaks, and the van skids to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: What is that? On the --

dialogues.speaker: ROAD
dialogues.text: -- in front of them lies a skeleton in a long dress. Clumps of brownish hair cling to a shattered skull, and both legs and one arm are broken off. On both sides of the road scattered across the neatly trimmed grass are strewn fragments of skulls, arms, legs, spines and hips.

dialogues.speaker: CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Many headstones turned over, graves dug up and mounds of earth everywhere. INT. JAMIвЂ™S VAN - NIGHT Mark recoils in horror.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Jesus! Jami jumps out of the van --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and takes of running through the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jami, wait. Mark jumps out of the van and chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mum. Jami's run slows to a staggered walk as she takes in what she is sees.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mum? A handful of graves have been dug up, and headstones tossed aside like cardboard props. On the ground in front of her lies a corpse, that of an old woman. She lies broken on the ground, with her an elegant dress darkened by rotting flesh. The corpse itself lies mouth agape with one eye open. The flesh has been stripped from one arm.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Don't look! Jami backs away, soundless, deep within the throes of a silent cry/scream. Mark quickly grabs hold of her as her legs go weak. Her eyes roll backwards, and she faints in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK (58), a police officer, stands at his bedroom window, soaking in the bright sunlight. He slowly buttons his shirt, getting ready for the day, but seems distant, lost in thought. He runs his hand along the window ledge, checking for dust.  7. The ledge is caked and the windows have been nailed shut with massive nails. Erik stops what heвЂ™s doing and sniffs the air. He quickly rushes out of the bedroom, and downstairs into the --

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: -- where he scrapes burnt eggs into the trash bin, on top of a pile of other burnt stuff. Erik realizes the time, and looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Oh shit. He grabs his brief case, kisses his finger, and --

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: (to photo) I'll see you when I get home. -- gently touches a picture of his beautiful wife. She appears carefree and youthful. As Erik backs down the drive, two MONGREL DOGS run across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual frantic sounds of a busy police station as Erik plows through the crowd, coffee protectively in hand. He comes to rest at his desk. His partner, REECE TRAVIS (40), is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: I've no idea. This reporter stopped a passing cruiser. Apparently the place is a mess, bodies everywhere. No, actually thatвЂ™s the weird part, no coffins... Flicking through his paperwork for the day, Erik spits coffee all over the place when he hears this.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Who was in the cruiser? Reece looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, hang on a second. Richards, I think. Erik jumps on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four large desks spread across the room in various stages of disarray. Several people rush around as Jami enters the main doors. With a fake half-smile, she barges straight into the --

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: -- where she takes a deep, cleansing breath to steel up her nerves. WALTER STYLES, blue goatee, red ponytail and Joe 90 spec's.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Jami. Heard about your mother. ItвЂ™s a pretty fucked situation I know but look, I find coffee fixes everything. He hits the intercom, Sally answers.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes Wally?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Would you be a dear and bring in two coffees? Walter turns off the intercom, cutting Sally off in mid- gripe. A fresh copy of the Courier lays open on the desk in front of him. He pops a couple of vitamin pills, and pushes the paper across to Jami.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s gonna kill me with all of this keep-fit-shit! Free word of advice: Never sleep with your secretary. Hey, you seen the front page yet? It's a grabber!  Jami spins the paper so it faces her.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: It has skeletons on the page, plus the headline, "WHO IS THE BODY SNATCHER?" Beneath that, in smaller print: "Jami Yearwood's shocking reveal this weekend"

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jami looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: The Body snatcher? Walter, what the hell--

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: People who pick up a mag or tab look for someone to blame for all the crap in their lives. A bad guy: Bin Laden, Jack the Ripper...

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Do you think this, body snatcherвЂ™ will strike again?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He already has! I got interested in this before last night, I gave Google a work out. Over the last two months the same thing happened at the Dutton Park and Bald Hills cemeteries. Missing bodies... yada- yada. Jami skims WalterвЂ™s piece as she sips coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Christ. What's going on with this city?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s what you are going to tell me. Now itвЂ™s gotten all fucked up and personal for you, I want you to go all out and find this bastard 'Body Snatcher'.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Walt, you know this isn't just one guy. No one can rip a cemetery up like that overnight by themselves--  10.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Maybe he's really strong, like a superhero. Maybe he drives around in a Bobcat? Who the fuck knows! Anyway, by narrowing it down to just the one weirdo will sell us more papers. Evil, babe... pure fucking evil!

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Superhero's? You wish. Hey, do I get expenses?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yes full, whatever you need! This guy is going to be a total cash cow.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The. Body. Snatcher. Now fuck the fuck off. Jami turns and storms out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik sits in his car in front of the locked gates of the Cemetery. He checks his watch. His car is littered with old scrap books with newspaper clippings.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS
dialogues.text: Headlines: "Child Missing" - "Family Missing" - "Town's Folk Disappear" - "Vampires... Trick or Treat?" - "Murder Plague Town"... The dates range from 40 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A torch shines in ErikвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Can I help you? Erik shows his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. The torch beam lowers.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I was here earlier investigating the vandalism incident.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The boss mentioned it when he called me in. I don't usually work Monday nights. My wife pitched a fit.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I bet she did.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I heard the same thing happened at Dutton Park a few weeks ago... Crazy world.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Crazy.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Do you want to take a look around? I've got an extra flashlight...

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: No need for that. Erik scans the area.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Is there a lock on the door of your little house there?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: If anyone comes to the gate tonight, man woman or child doesn't matter who, don't open your door. And if they attempt to open the gate themselves, please don't try to stop them. Greg takes a step away from ErikвЂ™s car. 11.  12.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What is this, a joke?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: It's for your own safety sir, these people are dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Whoever comes tonight don't listen to anything they say--

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Officer, I think you should go. He starts walking to the guard shack.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I'm calling your station!

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Please sir. Remember what I've said. Greg's flashlight shakes slightly as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... Greg disappears into his guard shack, and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Please, please... Let me be wrong. Erik looks over, concerned. Starts his car and slowly drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG COUPLE wander down a grubby street, the female is pregnant, they both look underfed, and aged beyond their years. A man, CUTTER, smiles at them and signals toward a nearby alley, the couple quickly enter it. Cutter slowly gets to his feet and swaggers off down the ally.  13. A LARGE MAN observes from the shadows across the street, when he sees them walk down the ally he slowly makes his way across the street towards them. The man runs off with the woman following close behind. They almost run into the dark figure. They look shocked, then ashamed as they quickly scurry away.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, come again. He laughs to himself, and gathers his stuff, about to leave. The dark figure steps into the mouth of the ally. Cutter looks up, surprised. He covers his eyes as the shadowed figure slowly strides toward him. FATHER ABEL STONESTREET (60).

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: This ain't your ally friend, best you turn around before I make you.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How long have you been dealing heroin to Peter and his wife, Cutter?

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Shit! Looks like I lost the bet.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Bet?

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: The boys and I had a bet going, to see how long it would take you to stick your nose in. Want a piece of the action. Let's face it Stony, you couldn't protect your own family. Like you can't protect these losers--

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I'm going to give you one chance, if I find you dealing in my area to my people again I will-

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: You will what? You play by a new set of rules now. Do unto others or some such shit...  14. Abel grabs Cutters shoulders and smashes him with a head butt, splitting the dealer's nose, and covering his face with blood. Cutter topples like a tree, and cracks the back of his head hard on the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: It's more of a guideline... Abel kneels next to him, and wipes Cutter's fresh blood off his own forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: If I ever see your scum-bag-ass around here again, friend, I will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey! Father Stonestreet! A small boy in blue jeans, LEON (12), runs excitedly up to Abel, holding on to a large pizza box.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Hey, Leon. What are you doing out of school? Abel stands, dabbing at Cutters blood still on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I have to take care of June. Dad didn't come home last night.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Out. He was playing cards for a little while with Aunt Mary... But that was last night.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Did you go around to his work today? Leon nods his head, glum. Abel ruffles his hair

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Are you and June okay?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yes Father.  15.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Your Dad left some money for you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s some in the top drawer. I got pizza! Is that man okay? Abel looks down at Cutter. He seems to be coming to.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Yes, he just had a fall. I'm taking care of him. You'd better get back home and give June her pizza before it goes cold. Hurry now, IвЂ™1l pop by later this evening... before it gets dark. Leon skips off. Abel drags the semi-conscious man to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I don't want to see anyone dealing around here ever again. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Yes. Cutter trembles like a leaf as he coughs up some blood.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: The only reason you're alive Cutter is so you can warn the others, do you understand? Cutter spits at Abel as he gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Watch your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel sits in the rear of the church, inside his sparse, student-style living quarters. The only bit of colour comes from the crayon drawings on blank white walls. Seemingly content, Abel drinks some water from the small sink. The CREAK of an opening, then closing door emits from the church. Abel goes out to investigate. At the --  16.

dialogues.speaker: ALTAR
dialogues.text: -- an eighteen year old man, JAKE, stares at the stained glass window.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Jake? Jacob Harvey? Good God, how you've grown! Please sit down. Its been too long.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'd almost forgotten what it looked like. Abel nods, and eyes the young man with intrigue.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You came to see me for a reason?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Both men share a silent moment as Jake tries to formulate.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Has Kelly dropped by?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Elliot? No... Why?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: She's pregnant, and now she's gone. Even her crazy mother doesn't know where she is. Abel nods his head, listening.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I went by the cops this morning and talked to the missing person's guy. He said she had to be gone for longer...

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Being pregnant, she's probably afraid to face her mother--

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't be! She's completely nuts and will totally kill me when she finds out.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We'll pop by and see her together. Maybe Mrs. Elliot will refrain from bloody murder if I'm by your side. But... Don't count on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the front steps a thin brown mongrel dog sleeps. Several windows are open, but the building seems unnaturally silent. Halfway up the steps, Jake turns to Abel.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Come on. Abel takes another step and the dog's head instantly raises. Its eyes burn.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Father. The dog stands and bares its teeth with a low, vibrating growl.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Who's dog is this? Jake shrugs. Abel moves forward again, and the dog crouches, like he's about to leap.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s not going to let us inside. Come on, lets try another way. They run out the door to an --

dialogues.speaker: ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: -- and find a door that leads to the basement. Jake kicks the door in. Abel gives him an intense stare. He shrugs. They descend the basement steps, and wind up in the basement.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel and Jake try to focus in the murky light. Although, they can see vague shapes: Mounds of papers, old televisions, a few old chairs and what looks like rolled up carpets and shower curtains. They cross the room, and climb some wooden stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out of a doorway, and spot the sleeping dog on the steps. The front door is behind the dog. They quietly climb the main --

dialogues.speaker: TENEMENT STAIRS
dialogues.text: -- talking in low voices as they go.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's quiet in here.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I was thinking the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel and Jake quietly step into the fourth floor hallway. The light is dim, and they can barely make out some of the opened apartment doors - many have deep scratches on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move up another floor to the fifth level, Abel stops to look at some new graffiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel touches the big brown letters, rubbing between his thumb and fore finger he quickly sniffs it.  19.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: This is blood. They go another couple of steps, and exit onto the fifth floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the hall, and peer into one of the open --

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT
dialogues.text: -- doors. ItвЂ™s a total wreck! Bits of shattered mirror on the floor; on the wall above the bed, written in blood:

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Newspapers stuck all over the bedroom window reduce the light to a pale haze. Jake and Abel enter. Jake rips the newspapers off. He opens a window for some much needed fresh air. Something moves in the room. Jake and Abel share a puzzled look. The sound of cloth as it rubs against cloth rises again. Jake stares at the bare mattress. The noise rises once again and he quickly figures out where it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Father. Jake moves to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Help me move this. They push the bed aside and under it is an oddly shaped cocoon of bed sheets wrapped tightly around what might be a two headed man.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I think we better call the police.  20. Jake continues to tear even more frantically at the sheet. Gray hair and a pale forehead, plus a second scalp. This one, however, with dark hair. Jake tears the sheet free from their faces. It's a man and his son. Their faces are white - drained. Abel reaches down and feels for heartbeats.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They're dead, aren't they? Why do they look like that?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I don't know. Jake stands. As he does, a shard of white sunlight falls across the mans face.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What's happened here? Behind them something rustles. They turn to see the man moves his legs within the sheet. His feet push against the floor, his arms tightly locked around his son. His grey lipped mouth twitches, as if he were about to scream.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He's not dead!

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Jake, get out! Now! Abel watches the man open his mouth and make a hideous, anguished moan that sounds like a low wind blowing through trees. His legs push frantic now and manages in a brief moment to squirm back under the bed. They twitch a few times then lay still. Abel crosses the room to the closet and opens it. At the bottom is a pile of old newspapers and clothes. Abel stares for a few moments, and then prods it with his foot. Something moves. He shifts uneasily, and slams the door shut. Hurries out to where Jake waits.  21.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: All right, now we get the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People cluster around the outside of the apartment building, police barriers already in place. Erik and Reece pass two paramedics with a stretcher. On top, is a woman with a white sheet up to her chin, which matches the colour of her skin. Her body writhes in agony as the sun hits her face. It contorts hideously, but no sound emits from her mouth. The woman is quickly loaded into one of the waiting ambulances.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Aren't these supposed to be corpses? God, what's wrong with that woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik flashes his badge at a nearby officer.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Where's Teal?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Third floor, captain. A small form in the corner of the entrance hall catches his eye. It's a dead dog, with a bullet hole in its head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter an apartment where Teal is speaking with Abel and Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Brookman. What do you have? Teal motions them away from the civilians.  22. As Erik does so, his shoes crunch on glass. He looks down, and realizes he stepped on shards of a broken mirror.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Father Abel Stonestreet and Jake Harvey found the first bodies. So far we've pulled thirty nine of them out of closets and from under beds. They were rolled up in shower curtains, rugs and sheets. Teal double-checks to see if anyone is listening.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Problem is, and this sounds crazy I know but...

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: The Medics have confirmed there are no vitals... but the hell of it is they just keep on moving! Some kind of a freakish muscle reflex? Trick of rigor mortis? Erik closes his eyes briefly, his hand rises up to his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Any type of wound, trauma on their bodies?

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: I checked a couple on my arrival, saw some cuts, bruises. That's about it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: No. That's not all. Another stretcher goes by. ItвЂ™s occupant has the same pale face as the first one.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Nothing. I'm thinking out loud. Where are the bodies being taken?  23.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Royal Brisbane. It's the nearest with the facilities to handle this many stiffs. Probably going to have to get the SES, bring a cold truck in anyway. What do you think Captain? Disease? Poison? Or something really out there, cult- like?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Not sure. Just keep it to yourself. We don't want to start a panic. Has the coroner arrived yet?

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Yes sir, upstairs... shall I go get her?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Sure, I'd like a minute or two with your witnesses first. Teal nods and leaves the apartment, closes the door behind him. Erik surveys the room, then the two men on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm Captain Brookman. I have a few questions--

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We've already given our statements.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I know, and I'm sorry to have to ask you to go over it again. Erik walks past them, taking a quick look into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: What do you think happened here, Father?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I have no idea. Jake and I came looking for Mrs. Elliot, who lives... lived on the fifth floor. We found the building just as it is now.  24.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I want to get out of here. I cant stand this place.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: A little longer okay? You saw the bodies. Are they dead or alive?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Sergeant Teal tells me thirty nine bodies have been found. How many people lived in this building?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I'd say a good fifty... sixty. Abel shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Not all the apartments were occupied?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What do you think happened to these people, officer? Erik leaves the room without saying a word. In the --

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: -- outside, Erik leans heavily against a wall, racks his brain. Teal and a female, DR. LADDY (45), approach.

dialogues.speaker: TEAL
dialogues.text: Captain? This is Dr. Laddy. They shake hands as another stretcher goes past. Erik catches a glimpse of the bodies again but looks away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LADDY
dialogues.text: Captain, I've never seen or heard of anything like this there's no pooling of blood, no rigor mortis... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DR. LADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, somehow the bodies are completely cool. I pricked the finger of one of them, and do you know what came out? Nothing. Erik listens. His worst fears realized.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LADDY
dialogues.text: They've been totally exsanguinated but there's no sign of haemorrhaging. I have called a colleague in from the North Side, to see if he can make any sense of it. A second perspective might help.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Nothing can help. Its too late. We've got to leave all of them here and burn this whole building to the ground with them inside, right now. Abel and Jake stand in the doorway and watch Erik start to lose it. Even a uniformed officer halfway down the corridor notices.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: What are you all looking at? You've seen the bodies! They're reacting to sunlight! They can sweep through a whole building in less than one night! How long do you think it will take them to do this to whole streets? We have to burn this building to the ground and kill them, because when these... these bodies wake up they're going to be thirsty! You can't take them to the Hospital! You can't let them get out into the streets! A hand grips his shoulder and spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Captain, come with me. Lets go get some coffee, okay? He jerks free and pushes Reece back. He turns to Abel.  26.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: You! You of all people should recognise the evil that's creeping up on this city! God in heaven, cant you feel it in there? Tell them not to let these things wake up! Abel is unsure at what he should say.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Father, please don't let the vampire loose on the streets! Tell them we have to burn the bodies! Reece tries to guide Erik toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Don't take them to the hospital. Burn them. Burn them all.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Come on Erik, take it easy. Abel stares at them as they head off down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frustrated doctor consults chart after chart, and shakes his weary head. He starts to prep yet another body for an autopsy. In the background table after table of bodies covered in sheets. He concentrates, about to make the first incision. A noise startles him. In the background every sheet covered body sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jami Yearwood walks through the --

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: -- which is open slightly.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mark? You home?  27. Silence - she steps into the dark room, feels along the wall until she finds the light-switch and turns it on. The living room is a complete and utter wreck.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mark? Jami quickly moves down the --

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: -- to his bedroom. The door is closed. She opens the door, steps into the --

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: -- and reaches around for the light-switch, but canвЂ™t find it. On the other side of the half opened door, Mark's dog snarls at her. Jami jumps back. The dog is hunched low to the floor, ready to leap.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Calvin? It's me boy, it's Jami. Where's Mark? The dog tilts its head as if he hears something, and leaps right past her, and down the hallway. Jami hears a muffled noise on the other side of the room. She reaches for the light switch, and finds it this time. The bed sheets are missing, but everything else seems okay. Something grips her around her ankle. Startled she looks down and sees a claw-like hand. Jami screams, and kicks like crazy, until she gets her ankle free. The noise starts up again. She staggers against the bedroom wall as a shape wrapped in bed sheets writhes its way out. As it works itself free, she can see that's it's --

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Mark!  28. The sheet slips off. Mark stands with his eyes blazing. He licks his lips with a black tongue.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Jami... As Mark steps toward her, a quick tongue flick across his thirsty lips. Jami turns and runs for the door. MarkвЂ™s hand grabs her blouse, but the sleeve just tears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jami makes it out into the courtyard. Over by Jami's car, other figures lurk amongst shadows. Faces grin lit up by the spotlights outside. Jami dares not look back. Mark launches himself at her. She hits the ground with a loud smack. Mark, on top of her now, grips her by the hair and forces her head back.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: No Mark! Please!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Ssshhhhhh... It's okay. Suddenly, Mark is lifted up and thrown off of her, only to be replaced by a very large man whose face is more terrifying then Mark's. He leans over Jami. His fangs bare, and move closer to her throat. Mark grips the man by his throat, and hauls him off. Jami gets to her feet as the two vampires fight and snap at each other like rabid animals. Jami turns and runs for her life. She turns her head toward a rustling sound in the bushes. ItвЂ™s a WOMAN in glittery dress. Jami dives into her car, and quickly rolls the windows up.  29.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: As Jamie drives off, the woman claws at the windshield and hammers it with her fists. Jami accelerates, and the woman rolls over the roof, off the back, and lands on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman chases after Jami, although she soon gives up. Jami speeds through several blocks before she pulls over. Horns blow as cars swerve to miss her. Jami is an emotional wreck. Suddenly a soft tap on the window. A face stares down at her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What the fuc--

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: License please, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik picking at his dinner, his hands shaking slightly. He looks at a picture of his wife, takes another small bite, then looks away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYEEMA OLIVER (33), reads in bed. Her husband, DAN, sleeps next to her. She puts her book down in mid-yawn. Suddenly, the smash of glass, and a loud, piercing scream. She leaps out of bed, and goes straight to the window. Tries to see what's going on. There is another scream, but this time its cut short mid- scream. She runs back to Dan and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Jesus... What is it?  30.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Something serious is happening next door, I heard screams. Dan sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Probably just shagging. Remember last week--

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: I know what fucking shagging sounds like. But I don't think Reece and Tilly are playing kinky cops tonight... A SHRILL stops Kyeema in her tracks. She rushes back to the --

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: -- and sees two shapes in the back yard, a MAN attacking a SMALL GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dan, Dan! Someone's in our back yard and he's hurting Megan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't make out the facial features of the man, who is all over the little girl. The floodlights come on, and the back door flies open. Dan rushes up with a baseball bat in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Get off her. No response. Kyeema looks down from the upstairs window, and frantically bangs on it to get DanвЂ™s attention.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'll crack your skull in if you don't get the fuck off her now! As Dan gets closer, the scene looks very wrong.  31. ItвЂ™s not the man who is attacking the girl. ItвЂ™s the who is attacking, and draining blood, from him. She somehow manages to hold him up. Dan realizes itвЂ™s her father - Reece!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Reece? Megan? What in gods name... Megan drops her father; he falls like the dead weight he is. She turns and moves toward Dan at lightning speed. Before he can react, she brings him down hard on his back. She squats on his chest, grabs the bat and throws it toward the house. Megan hisses, and leans in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Megan, no, no! A scream tears through the night as Kyeema sprints out of the house like Usain Bolt. Within seconds, she has the bat, and takes an almighty swing at Megan. She connects beautifully with Megan's little head.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: The same sound of a home run shot in the World Series. Megan FLIES backwards off Dan, and hits the ground very hard. Kyeema helps Dan to his feet and they scramble to the safety of the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Kyeema watch from inside as she clicks her dislocated neck back into place. Dan creeps over to the door. Kyeema grabs a hold of him, and pulls him to the floor. Megan is right at the back door. She taps on the window, and slowly scratches on the door. Kyeema looks up.  32.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Go away Megan. Please go away!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Go home, Megan! Now. There are a few beats of silence. Kyeema shakes with fear. Dan in shock. Both of them are too scared to even breathe. They wait for another sound from Megan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly drift through a room softly lit by candles. A thin shape sits in the semi darkness. ROLLAND MARMERCHANT. His frame is obscured by a robe and a hood. Red eyes glow beneath the hood. As a tall, bald, muscular man, STITCH, stands in the doorway. He bows and enters.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Mr. Stitch.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: We grow stronger every night.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Soon my name will be written in the history of a new world. Our world.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Things are changing rapidly master. Our existence will not remain secret for too much longer.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: We no longer have anything to fear. It's time to step from out of shadows. Show these humans who the true dominant species on earth really are... A grin spreads over Stitches face.  33.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: We shall carve our legend into the annals of the new race. In my name.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: In your name. Rolland's smile quickly fades.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Do you have any more news from the borders to the south?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Nothing yet, but I don't predict any threat. House Rancall are governed by fools.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Agreed but I hear rumours; a power shift. We canвЂ™t afford to underestimate any thing, not now.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: I'll double the border patrols.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Very well, I shall leave it in your capable hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jami tosses uneasily in the bed of her small, studio apartment. A packet of sleeping pills and bottle of vodka on the bedside table tell her story. She murmurs Mark's name, then lets out a faint whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel splashes water onto his face, and goes to the single window of his room. He opens it, and inhales a lung full of air. His eyes widen as he spots the alley wall across the way.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY WALL
dialogues.text: In blood red writing, the words, вЂњFOLLOW THE MASTER.вЂќ  34.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Abel stares hard at the message for a few seconds. Thoroughly shaken, he turns from the window, and gets dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik pulls a can of black spray paint out of a paper bag. He shakes it and sprays on the front side of his open front door, a large black crucifix above the word: вЂњBEWARE вЂ” VAMPIRE KILLER!вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young woman, KELLY (24), stands outside Jake's apartment door. She knocks. Movement inside, but no one answers. She knocks even harder.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jake! Open the door! Its me!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Kelly? Jake steps to the door, unlocks and throws it open. Instantly she leaps forward into his arms and buries her face into his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Kelly! I've been going crazy looking for you!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Don't say anything, please. Just hold me. Tight. Tighter.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You're freezing. Where have you been? God, I'm so glad to see you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Don't talk. Just make me warm. She lifts her head back, her eyes an unnatural yellow.  35.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Make me warm. Her mouth opens and her fangs slide out.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No! He pushes her away and takes step backward. He trips and cracks his head on the edge of a table.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jake. I've come back for you. I've come back.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Get away!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We can be together forever.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yes, forever and ever. Jake screams and thrusts his arms out trying to sustain his life for a few brief moments more. Kelly catches his right arm, grins and sinks her teeth into a vein on his wrist. When she is finished she lets his arm drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Now we'll be together for always. We'll always be young... And we'll always be in love. Sleep my precious, sleep. She gathers the sheets off the unmade bed and wraps him up. She then drags Jake into the closet, piles a few papers and card board boxes around him and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stitch stands in front of a large Fireplace. His features can hardly be recognized from the blaze of the fire. Rolland enters.  36.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: My favourite pupil. My army grows. Yes?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Close to one hundred and fifty thousand, master.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: We need more. And quick, we only have once chance before we lose the element of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Master, we double in strength every night--

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: I want an orgy of hunger! A celebration of power unlike any this or any planet in the history of time has ever seen. Let them run amok and take as many as they can. Rolland shuts his eyes. When he opens them again, theyвЂ™ as bright as blast furnaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gentle knock-knock on her front door. The blinds are drawn and the door has a solid chair propped up against it. Half empty cups of coffee and bottles of alcohol are spread everywhere. Jami, wrapped in blankets on the couch, and watches white noise on the TELEVISION. Someone knocks on the front door. She ignores it and turns down the hiss on her screen. The knocks stop briefly, then starts up again.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Damn it! She jumps up and shouts through her closed door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Who is it?  37.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Erik. Captain Brookman from--

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What do you want? A torn piece of paper slides under the door.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your help. Please, come round to my home later. I really need to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik closes the door behind Jami, and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Thank you. Please take a seat. Can I get you--

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Coffee, please. Erik goes into the kitchen. Jami scans the room. She raises an eyebrow at the clearly nailed shut windows.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What's with the windows?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I'll explain when the priest gets here.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: A priest? What is this, a shotgun wedding? A knock at the door. Erik re-enters the room, smirks at her humour ,and opens the front door to father Abel Stonestreet.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Come in, Father. Thank you for coming. Jami stares at him as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Father Stonestreet, this is reporter Jami Yearwood.  38. He shakes Jami's hand. She glances at the nailed shut windows.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Please, call me Abel. Now Captain, I'd like to know why you called me. There must be a dozen Catholic churches within a twenty kilometre radius of here.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I called because I thought you would understand the gravity of the situation. You were there. You saw the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: The vampires? There are many evils in the world. Drug dealers, child beaters, homicidal maniacs, rapists. I think we both have more than enough work Captain without inventing any more.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Open your mind, Father.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve seen them too. He isn't crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Miss?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I have seen them. The officer is right. They do exist.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Please Father, sit.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: The signs are everywhere, this isn't the first time this has happened, just not on this scale.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Why haven't we seen anything in the news?  39.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Because they are careful. This has been going on for decades; centuries, even. If a small country town disappears, who will notice, let alone care?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Brisbane isn't a country town.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Which means that something big is happening.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: How come you know all of this other stuff? Erik drops a huge scrap book on the table in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: This was my mothers. For the longest time I thought my mother was crazy. She shot my father in the face the night we moved to the city.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Good lord.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: When I got older I had her put in a home, she was always rambling about the shadows outside at night, and things coming to get her. She had even nailed the windows shut. Abel and Jami swap glances.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: After she died I found this scrapbook, and six others like it, filled with news clippings about missing people, small townships where every resident just upped and apparently left... Plain disappeared.  40.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Can't we tell someone? My paper eats this type of stuff for breakfast, it would be a nice change for it to actually be real.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: So how do you kill a vampire?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Stakes to the heart, sunlight and decapitation seem to be the only things that kill them.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You've killed a vampire then?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Yes... My wife. Jamie and Abel exchange looks. They are trapped in a house with a murderer who is clearly agitated, obsessive, and possibly psychotic.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Father, Jami, we all know that evil remains constant, if they do exist and they feel strong enough to take us on. They could attack in the hope it will be too late for us to fight back.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Jesus. Erik tosses a small local map on the table along with a few photo's.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: There are a network of caves under these factories in and around this area. I've done some scouting. I believe they are using this factory and entering the caves from there. Would you be willing to go with me?  41.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: If by some devilish way you are right, I have to stay and work out a way to protect the members of my parish. Erik removes a cardboard box filled with short wooden stakes.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: You're a good man Father, you always have been. You have to do what you feel is the right thing to do, thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I hope you're wrong. But if you're not, God be with you.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: And may he be with you too. Erik opens the front door for him and he heads to his car without looking back. The wind whistles down the street. A large German Shepherd sleeps on the front steps of the house directly opposite. Erik eyes it nervously and shuts and locks his front door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I'd like to go with you.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Thank you Miss Yearwood but I warn you, this is not for the weak hearted.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I know. Now let's go!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. DAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: Dan paces back and forth between his car and front door.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Damn it, Kyeema! Kyeema charges out of the front door with bags in hand.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: What's the problem?  42.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We're going to miss the plane.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: I'm going as fast as I can. Dan grabs her bags and throws them into the back of the car. They both get inside the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: I was making something for you. She reaches into her pocket and pulls out something wrapped in tissue paper and tied with a rubber band.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: It keeps evil away. You must always carry it in your pocket. Dan nods, slips it inside his jacket, and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How about yours? Kyeema sits quietly as Dan drives off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You did make one for yourself, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: No. You wanted me to hurry. Dan digs in his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Keep this one then. Kyeema grabs his wrist firmly.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: No Daniel. It won't work for me. It has a few strands of your hair-- Watch where you're friggin-well- going! Dan looks back to the road as a Porsche tears past him in the opposite direction. They take the AIRPORT EXIT, and traffic slows to an almost stop.  43.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We're going to be fine. We'll get ourselves a room at a nice resort on the beach and lay out in the sun for a week.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to these people?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't know... Just want to get as far away from here, as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: How will we know if any place is ever far enough away? Dan doesn't really hear, as he sees the highway become nothing but a parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, no, no!

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Almost four. Shit! We're going to miss our plane.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: But... They come out when it's dark--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know! You haven't shut up about them since last night! Dan punches the steering wheel. Kyeema wells up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Kyeema nods but doesn't look at him. Dan peers out a window.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Do you know where I'd like to be right now? A beach in Maldives. How would you like that?

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ERIK'S CAR
dialogues.text: Now dusk, Jami and Erik sit in Erik's knackered car ina side street, neither one impressed with their current predicament.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Damn. Had a service only last week.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: We could make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I don't know. We are a good seven, eight blocks. Is that a bit too far? It grows steadily darker outside.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What about the other houses?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Maybe but do you see any lights on? How do we know we aren't stepping into a nest full of vampires? My house was protected. These are just inviting invasion.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting we just sit here?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We can't. It's nearly dark. Jami makes their minds up, and hops out of the car. Erik quickly joins her and they move toward some dark shapes on the right hand side of the street. A two-story house with no lights on materializes through the darkness. Erik almost steps on the corpse of a YOUNG GIRL, pushed into the gutter. Erik pulls a horrified Jami along and they rush to the front door.  45.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Stay close.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ABANDONED HOUSE
dialogues.text: Erik turns the front door handle, it opens, and they quickly enter And Erik slams the door shut, bolts it behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We should be safe here. Erik scans the area.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What if we're not alone? Erik shouts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Hello! Anyone home? Erik takes his gun out of his holster and walks into a short --

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: -- where a flight of stairs leads up to a --

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: They step into the landing, and huddle close.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Anyone here? No reply. He puts his gun away and returns to the --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Erik turns to Jami, a worried look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I think we're alone. And that is exactly where they want us.  46.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: What? In this house?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Trapped. All of us. Everyone in this cursed city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many people huddle inside the church. The Father stands guard at the front door, and looks for more people. Occasionally a figure moves way off in the distance. He has a brainwave and turns to Leon.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Leon. Leon looks up. There is fear in his face.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yes, Father.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You know where the staircase to the bell tower is, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I want you to climb to the tower, and crack open the shutters up there, you'll see the handles. Then I want you to take the rope that hangs down and pull on it as hard as you can. The bell may lift you off your feet, but that's all right, you'll come down again. Just don't let go of the rope, and keep ringing the bell. Can you do that? Leon nods excitedly at the important mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Kyeema still stuck in a parking lot of a highway.  47.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We can't stay here. I know it's dark, but we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Anywhere but here!

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: You don't have to yell.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Kyeema, I'm sorry, but we can't just wait in the dark to die.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: What about all these other people?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They are not our problem. That exit leads back to town, we're close enough to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel enters the tenement, and he bangs on the first door.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Charlie! Get your wife and children! You're going to have to come to the church with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dan and Kyeema move in and out of traffic, they find fewer and fewer cars running with less and less people in them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I've got a bad feeling about this.

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Me too, let's run.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Can you hear that bell ringing? They jog down an off ramp when Dan hears a rumble in the distance.  48. He looks over his shoulder and sees Headlights move quickly toward them. Motorcycles, fifteen or twenty of them. Dan waves them down.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: KYEEMA
dialogues.text: Wait Dan. I don't think... The bikers lights turn toward them and as they pass under the streetlights it shows the bikers pale faces, with a mouthful of killer fangs. Dan grabs Kyeema to make their escape, but the bikers are on top of them. One biker lashes out and lands a well-timed boot into Dan's rib cage and he hits the ground fighting for breath. Kyeema is so petrified she cannot even scream.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Hellloooo! Dan rolls over in agony and he sees the blue goatee, red ponytail of Walter, who not only rides a Hog but is now a Vampire

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: There isn't very much to this one.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCH
dialogues.text: Stitch! You said I get the next. Walter jerks his head back and suddenly rubs and blinks his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Holy shit, what is that! My eyes are fuckin' on fire! Walter leaps off and backs away from Dan.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He's got something on his clothes... garlic or something. Gaaaah, I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Forget him. He will be dead soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: God, If I don't die first, I can see the front page now.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Come on ladies, saddle up. He turns to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: I'm taking your woman with me. I'll be keeping her nice and warm, you just lay there and think about that, okay? As the glow from the bikers headlights fades into the darkness, Dan painfully gets to his feet. The bell still sounds, as he slowly makes his way down the off ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a long human chain of people, all ages, shapes and sizes. Abel briefs before he leads them back to the church. Still the Bell chimes in the background.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Listen, all of you! We're going to follow the sound of the bell back to the church. Everyone grab the shoulder of the person in front of you and hold on tight! People look scared and mutter among themselves.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, just hold on tight! As long as we stay together we will be fine. The line of people exit the front doors and out to the --

dialogues.speaker: STREETS
dialogues.text: A deathly scream pierces the night, and then fades away.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Keep moving!  50.

dialogues.speaker: ALVIN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mandell is gone! Something pulled her out of the chain!

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Holy God in heaven... Another scream fades into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Fiona!? What happen' to my little girl? FIOONNNAAAAAA! The woman tries to leave the chain.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Hold on to her! Keep going! A female figure runs in front of him, and flashes a huge set of fangs. She grins, and just as quick as she appeared, she disappears. Suddenly another scream sounds out from the back of the chain.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Faster! Come on keep moving! Movement and dark shapes seems to FLIT all around them.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We're here! Abel feels Alvin's hand let go of his shoulder. Abel turns and sees that Alvin and his wife have gone. Their daughter stands there shaking. He grabs her hand and ushers the remaining people inside the --

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: -- where he ushers them into a far corner.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: John, go up to the tower and take over the bell from Leon. Keep ringing until I send someone else up.  51. He picks up a heavy brass crucifix and quickly walks back to the front door and out into the --

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Abel is about to enter another building, when a voice cries out.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Father Stonestreet! Help me! He looks up at a grey building. On the second floor, a little girls face peers from a window pane. A hand pulls her back away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel looks around, trying to get his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: June? Its Father Stonestreet! Where are you? Muffled sobs come from behind a nearby door. He busts in, crucifix still in hand, she is standing in the corner, bare feet and dark rings under her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Oh my. Thank God I've found you. He bends down and pick's her up. Her arms hang limply.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you Father.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: June, where is the bad man who took you? Her eyes grow wide and she stares past Abel.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Behind you. Abel places June down and turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Stay behind me, June.  52. Cutter grins, his fangs slide out of his upper and lower jaws.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Everything old is new again. Like the new look? Abel hoists the crucifix, Cutter raises his hands in mock fear.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I warned you Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: You do realize crucifixes don't hurt us? Dealer moves very quickly toward Abel, who stands his ground. Abel swings the crucifix in a large, vicious arc as though it were a bat. It rips Cutter's head clean off, and rolls into a corner. His body crumples to the floor at Abel's feet.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You were saying? The body withers to a husk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel carries June in his arms and rushes to the front door of the church. A hand lunges out of the darkness grabbing StonestreetвЂ™ shoulder. In one twisting fluid movement Stonestreet grabs the hand, sets June down and swings around pulling what's attached to the hand toward him for a beating. The face of Dan Oliver appears in front of Stonestreet, tired, dazed and confused.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, donвЂ™t. Please... Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolland surveys the map of the city, spread out over the large heavy table.  53. Stitch is on his right, and Hagen on his left.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: I've had reports from the north and the south. They are all panicking, trying to escape.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Were they stopped?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Mostly. But we--

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Were they stopped?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: We need more troops to patrol the city.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: No escapes, no survivors, no excuses. Do you understand? I want those gaps filled.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Immediately, Master.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Good. And riders, how many do we command now?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Thirty five hundred. Another fifteen hundred will be ready tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: We are so close Mr. Stitch. It's time to sleep, and sleep well. Rolland watches Stitch leave but Hagen stays put.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Shall I feed the dogs?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: No, not yet. Just make sure they're out at sunrise. RollandвЂ™s attention falls back to the map, mesmerized.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik sits at the kitchen table, a bowl of fruit in front of him. He chews on an apple. Jami has her head in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: So, what happens at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: The vampires go crawling to their coffins or whatever, what about us? What do we do? Erik is silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We must finish what we started.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Why Brisbane? Why not somewhere important like Canberra?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, but imagine a city of vampires. If they take Brisbane, what's to stop them taking the whole country, city by city... State by state.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: How are we going to get to the master?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I'm going to try to get some sleep. God knows I need it. Jami gets up and heads for the stairs. She makes her way up the stairs and opens the door of the first room on the top landing. It is a bedroom. She spots a couple of pillows on the bed, but the blankets had been kicked off the bed.  55. She grabs both pillows and turns to walk back out. As she reaches the door of the bedroom, something clicks in her brain.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: (sotto) Oh shit. The sheets are missing. She turns back and scans the room, something shifts heavily, plus the noise of cloth being ripped.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Oh no. Erik! The wardrobe door slowly swings open and a cocoon shape writhes out from inside.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Nooooo! A body tumbles out of the wardrobe, a grey haired man, his legs still wrapped in a bed sheet. He looks up at Jami, and gives her a warm grandfatherly smile. Jami backs cautiously out of the bedroom. A woman's head pops out of a cocoon under the bed. Jami screams. She boogies down the stairs, but the grey haired vampire is just too quick. He grabs her by the hair and jerks her back. She loses her balance and falls back, lands at his feet. Erik stands at the foot of the stairs. The vampire crawls on top of Jami and has his fangs fractions from her throat. The vampire looks up, seems to sense something isn't right. Erik jams a stake through his mouth and the tip Breaches the very back of his skull. The vampire reels back and struggles to rip the stake from his head. The Female Vampire appears at the top of the stairs and helps her partner pull the stake out.  56. With a grunt she manages to dislodge it and drops it onto the floor. They share a look and run into the room they came from. A crash as splintered wood and glass blast on to the street as they jump out the window and off into the night. Erik and Jami watch as the two figures slip off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Sorry, my fault. I should've checked more thoroughly. Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Let me get my breath back, okay? Erik walks down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Good. Let's check the whole house. They go toward the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: How long until sunrise?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Five hours or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel checks on Dan, huddled on a pew with a blanket wrapped around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Father, did a woman come in last night? Aboriginal, very beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I am so sorry. No one came in after you. Dan nods, half-smiles but is on the verge of tears. His wounds have been dressed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They took her. It was my fault they took her.  57.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What's your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dan. Dan Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Dan, you need to rest. Dan winces with pain.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How bad am I?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Nothing serious. How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Pretty fucked... Sorry Father. Dan looks at a brightening window.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Where do you think the riders went?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know But IвЂ™ve got to do something. I've got to find my wife.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere. You need rest.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Father. You didn't see them. You don't know what they are, what they could do to her--

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How far do you think you'll get? How will you help her? You don't even know where you're going. He can see the anger build in Dan's eyes and tries to calm.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Would you like some water?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No. I should try to get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: All right. If you'll excuse me.  58. Abel moves quickly away from Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jami suddenly jolts up and screams. She looks all around, Erik stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Good morning. Erik turns back to the window and continues to look out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Morning... Bad dream. They were all over me. Erik acknowledges with a slight nod.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: How are we going to get there?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Drive a few blocks west, then head north.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Drive? The car wouldn't start?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Our lovely couple left us a car with a full tank.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Let's load up and move out before they return with the rest of the family. Together, they head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People tend to each other. Some still sleep, some cry. Abel moves from group to group, tries his best to set everyone at ease. A few others help pass around water, and attend to the injured. Dan off to the side looks in deep thought. An elderly lady comes by to check on him  59. Dan stands and moves to the front doors. He unbolts it as Abel appears right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: And where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Just stay out of my way, Father. I appreciate your help, but I've got to help Kyeema. Dan tries to move past Abel, but Abel grabs him by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How do you expect to find her on foot?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm taking the Land Rover outside.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Do you really think you can just drive in, kill the bad guys, save your wife and walk out?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Daniel, she may already be like them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: But maybe she's not... Maybe there's some reason why they didn't just kill her there and then. And if she is still alive... then she needs me.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why? Abel speaks to the other helpers and they all hug him. He returns to Dan and gives him a small nod.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: All right. Let's go.  60.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I know where they might be keeping her and the Land RoverвЂ™s mine.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. LAND ROVER, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Dan changes gears and they zip through a corner. The dashboard is lit up like an aeroplane cockpit. Abel scans the road up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why are you helping me?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: It's the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Erik struggles to negotiate the many abandoned cars and makes very slow progress. He slams his hand down on the horn in total frustration.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: It's going to be sunset again before we get there through this.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Maybe it will clear further on down the road.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Maybe, maybe not. It would almost be quicker to walk. Erik and Jami share a thoughtful stare for a moment. The car screeches to a halt and both get out. Erik grabs the backpack and they carry on, at a slow jog. They pass ditched cars, bikes and trucks. They pass ditched cars, bikes trucks as they cross roads and footpaths.  61.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. LAND ROVER
dialogues.text: The Land Rover slows to a crawl.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm not sure but I think I saw something back there. That warehouse on the right about fifty meters back. Looked like coffins, stacked upon the dock... least I think they were coffins. Dan quickly reverses. On the dock a pile is covered with a dark green tarpaulin. It flutters a few times and expose many coffins beneath.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There! Dan points at the coffins.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm going in.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Not on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warehouse is the size of a football field. On the dock, Dan pulls the tarpaulin off the caskets. The wind whips it away. He opens the lid. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I wouldn't sleep outside. Would you? Dan looks toward a large sliding door set in the wall. He opens it a few feet, and steps into the --

dialogues.speaker: WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: A few forklift trucks, plus row after row, after row -вЂ” absolutely thousands of coffins.  62.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. This is where they sleep. My God! How many warehouses like this do you think there are? Dan leans over and opens the casket nearest him. Inside is a young man, with a blood spotted shirt, his arms crossed over his chest. Very softly, Dan hears a small voice whisper --

dialogues.speaker: SOFT VOICE
dialogues.text: Lean in just a little bit closer. Dan quickly closes the coffin lid with his foot. Abel opens a coffin. In it is a little black girl, her skin is faded to a sick pasty gray. She shifts suddenly, grips the caskets sides, then lay still again. Abel closes the lid, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Help me drag one into the light. They get either end of the first casket Dan opened, and push and pull it back out onto the loading dock and into the bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Ready? Dan flips the lid off and steps back. The vampire instantly writhes and claws at the sides of the casket. Its mouth opens and screams like nothing youвЂ™ve ever heard before in your life! The vampire sits up violently. Its gaze has fallen upon Abel and raises its head twisted at an angle away from the sunlight. Dan shoves Abel back inside the warehouse, and slides the door shut. The vampire hurtles forward and frantically tries to open the metal door. Both men struggle to keep it out. The door shudders as the vampire hammers and then scratches at it like an animal.  63. The clawing stops. Abel looks behind him, thinks he can hear something.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It's a trick. Dan slides the door slightly. The lid is back on the casket. As the door opens wider, Abel hears more noises as light streams into the warehouse. Dan steps back out onto the loading dock and throws open the lid again. The vampire, hideously bloated, sits up and snaps at Dan's face. Fluids bubble beneath the things flesh. It leaks from the mouth, eyes and nose. Just as it looks like it will explode, it rapidly shrivels into something as thin and frail as a dead leaf. Dan vomits. Abel looks toward the warehouse again. Abel rushes to the Land Rover and grabs stuff from the tailgate. He returns with a can of fuel and a .45 jammed in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Start the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Where did you get that gun? What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What we are here to do. Dan catches a wake up. Abel goes into the warehouse as he quickly jumps back inside the

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. LAND ROVER, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Dan turns on the ignition as a gunshot sounds out. He jumps. Bloodcurdling screams sound out from inside the warehouse. Thick black smoke fills the sky.  64. Abel hops into the Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
