dialogues.text: Drive. Very, very fast. Dan blasts the Land Rover through the front gates.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Do you think they will all burn?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Some of them will. And if they do get out, the sunlight will finish them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I didn't know there were so many.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What if there are a hundred more places like this. Abel takes the gun out of his pants and lays it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You never know when it might come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It's almost one. We have to hurry... EXT. STREET вЂ”- DAY Erik stops to catch his breath. Jami looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's been a while since I've had to run so much.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: I didn't think it would take so long.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Not far now. They take off again at a brisk walk.  65. They pass a shop that has all the windows blacked out with paper and various other items.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. LAND ROVER
dialogues.text: A parking lot of abandoned cars and trucks force Dan and Abel to stop.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We're going to have to make it on foot the rest of the way. How far is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: What you find may not be the person you knew.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Then you also know that once we get in there, we may not be coming out. Dan nods. Abel and Dan gear up and start to hike up the road. Abel sees something move up ahead, something quick and smaller than a man. He pulls the gun out. There's another quick movement off to the right in the bushes. Sudden a huge reddish brown mongrel, with bright yellow eyes leaps out at them. The dog drops to the ground, his skull split open by a bullet. Something strikes the back of Dan's knees he staggers and wrenches his leg away from a collie. He turns and kicks the dog in the ribs. Abel shoots it in the head.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We can't stop now.  66. Dogs come from out of everywhere and circle the two men. Abel fires off a few rounds. A few yelps, and they all disperse.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Hurry, they'll be back. The road straightens with factories on all around. Huge, dark and forbidding, the biggest of which has lights on inside, with trucks and bikes parked around it. A metal fence surrounds it. Dan and Abel check it out.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How do we get over that?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm not letting a fence stop me now. They walk down the drive toward the large obstacle with a tangle of barbed wire six feet above. Dan climbs over the fence as Abel boosts him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we can see is a close up of a closed eyelid. Slowly the camera pulls back to reveal Rolland's sleeping face. Suddenly his eyes flick open. Something is wrong. Something is out of place. Dogs howl, but they are howls of fear and anger. Rolland realizes something isn't right. He moves to the door, unbolts it and stands in the long hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Hagen. Rolland's voice echoes and moves throughout the lair. There is chatter among other vampires, but it all silences as they hear their master call.  67.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Hagen! Hurried steps thunder down the hallway as Hagen rushes to get to his master.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Starting the fire in the council chamber. It is ready for you, Master.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: The dogs are disquieted. Someone may have gotten past them.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: How? Who? Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Come with me. Rolland moves past Hagen along the cave like corridor to a narrow stairway that curves up to a double bolted door. He unlocks it and steps into a

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY ROOM
dialogues.text: With a bank of glowing monitors. Security cameras covering every angle outside. Dusk has taken hold on its journey toward darkness. The dogs howl off in the distance. Rolland scans the monitors as Hagen looks on. At first he can see nothing, everything seems normal. Then he catches movement outside the main gate as he sees Dan and Abel slink through the grounds. Slowly he smiles and turns to Hagen.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Find Mr. Stitch. You and he bring those two to the council chamber. And understand, I don't want them touched. Not yet. Hagen nods and scurries out the door. Rolland leans toward the monitor watching them.  68. He cracks up as he laughs his long fangs slide out of their sockets in his jaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen rushes through narrow corridors, tunnels and stair cases. The cave system under the factory is a maze in its layout. He reaches a solid door and bashes on it

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Stitch! We have intruders and the master wants to see them. A bolt slides across steel and wood then the Door swings inward. The room is totally black and Hagen strains to see inside. Stitch gives him the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: The master wants me to go with you to collect them. He moves forward slightly, still trying to see into the black.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Hello? Mr. Stitch? Hagen moves closer, strains his eyes even more. Two red eyes open and look directly at him. Hagen jumps back in fright as Stitch strides out of the room and laughs in a mean-spirited sort of way.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: How many and where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Abel hug the side of the factory as they make there way to the back of the old building, passing bikes, trucks and other items of equipment and vehicles. They find a half open roller door and slowly approach it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go. Are you ready?  69.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: God help us. INT. LAIR вЂ”- DAY Dan and Abel enter a loading dock type area the air is thick with the rotting stench of dog shit. The pair try not to vomit as they start to gag on the smell.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: This must be where those dogs came from. They quickly move to the back of the dock and into a small passage. They cut through a large arch, and emerge on the factory floor. There is barely any light now. Rubbish is everywhere. The inside of the old factory is empty, totally gutted. The pair begin to look worried until Dan spots a set of stairs leading down.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It looks like we go down there. Abel freezes. He signals to Dan to be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? Abel and Dan move back to back and slowly head toward the stairs. Now night no more sunlight to save them as the vampires wake. The sound of hundreds of vampires as they stir, begin to filter down to the factory floor: CRIES, CREAKS, LOUD BANGS, WHISPERS AND LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You think they know weвЂ™re here?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Pretty damn sure of it. They continue down to the --

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LEVEL
dialogues.text: -- where dark shapes move around on the cave floor.  70. The staircase for the next level down is on the opposite side of the large space, they set off at a quick pace. Halfway to the staircase a grubby hungry looking vampire woman steps out of a dark recess. Dan is directly in her line of sight as she leaps at him. Dan lands flat on his back, which knocks the wind out of him. She throws her head back, and prepares to strike. Then a flash of black as a massive boot cracks her in the face. Abel helps Dan to his feet, and steps in front of him as the female vampire readies herself. She crouches on the ground like a spider, ready to jump. Suddenly a look of fear washes over her face as she backs off, and scurries away like a cockroach. A meaty punch and the sound of a dead weight hitting the floor makes Abel spin around. Stitch, grins wickedly as Hagen scoops Dan up and throws him over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Put him down.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: The master wants to see you. Abel sees Dan is still alive, he can feel the anger of old washing over him again. He sinks his hands deep into his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I told you, put him down. I won't tell you again. Stitch finds Abel funny and laughs, he looks at Hagen, who smiles wildly. Abel has the one chance heвЂ™s prayed for, and pulls his brass-knuckle clad hands out of his pockets. Hagen's expression drops as he sees what Stitch can't. Abel takes a massive swing, as Stitch turns back toward him. The mighty punch connects and spins Stitch around.  71. Stitch rides the momentum of the punch and spins with a body blow which lifts Abel off his feet and sends him Flying down the walk way. Stitch breaths heavy and bleeds from the mouth. He stalks over Abel who lays there and groans on his back. He stares at him for a moment, before he hoisting him over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik sees a small road that he recognizes as the one that leads to the street.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We're close The factory's at the top of this road! Erik turns to Jami.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: As good as can be expected.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Then let's do what we came for. They pass the Land Rover that Dan and Abel left, past a few dead dogs. A howling all around them but the dogs keep their distance. As the old factory appears out of the gloom both stop in their tracks in awe.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: My God, help us. A loud piercing whistle screeches through the night. The howling of the dogs stop as they all run off.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Feeding time. Let's find out where they are going. They follow the massive gate around to an opening where the dogs whine and bark.  72. The mechanical clatter of gears and chains as the barking dies down. Jami runs ahead and sees the dogs scurry in where the driveway turns under an arch and into the factory's rear courtyard. An internal gate has been hoisted open just enough for the dogs to get through.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Hurry, you bastards! Come on! Inside! Jami squeezes herself against a wall. She hears the gate slowly close. As soon as everyone is gone, she slides over to the gate and peers in. Some removal vans, a yellow bull dozer, and a black van. Jami sees Hagen throw open a heavy wooden door, the dogs scramble over each other and try to get through. A couple snarl and snap at Hagen, he picks up a huge wooden staff and whacks a few.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Get down there! You bastards! When all the dogs are in, he steps through the door, and closes it behind him. Erik appears over Jami's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: He must be still human. He curls his hands around the bars. He looks the gate up and down, and scrapes some of the dirt away from the bottom, it comes away quite easily.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: God bless those dogs. The gap is still very small; Jami takes her Market off and squeezes through. She runs over to the chain hanging down from a couple of iron pulleys along the wall, and gets the gate about two feet off the ground. Just enough for Erik to get through. Together, they hurry to the heavy wooden door.  73. The door is locked, Erik gives it three hard blows with the hammer and it gives way.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I don't think the vampires will sleep with the dogs. Let's go in. The sound of dogs is getting louder.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get back! I'll knock your ribs in! A dog growls, then there is a blow and several yelps. They approach the half open door and see Hagen's back.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Get back, there! Here. You shit! The dogs snap at the food Hagen throws to them. Erik tightens his grip on the hammer then slips into the room. Quickly and quietly he moves toward Hagen. Before he can reach him a few dogs begin to growl. Erik runs headlong at Hagen who swings his staff around and Clips Erik in the hand; they both fall to the ground. Hagen has a vice like grip around Erik's hammer hand, the other hand around Erik's throat. The dogs grab at cuffs and sleeves and snap at their faces. Erik strikes Hagen square in the face. Blood streams from his nose but Hagen just grins madly as his grip on Erik's neck tighten. Hagen rolls Erik onto his back and pins his hammer hand with his knee. He tightens his other hand around Erik's throat. Dogs fight with each other and nip at Erik and Hagen. Jami rushes into the room, picks up the staff and swings it into the back of Hagen's head.  74.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Get off him! She strikes him again and when she strikes him for a third time the staff breaks in half. Hagen pitches to the side; his head hits the cold stone floor with a solid thud. Erik gasps for air as he stands and rubs his neck, he slowly backs away from the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Is he dead? Did I kill him? The dogs fight over the body, and try to drag the body all around the floor. They chew on his ears and fingers.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: No, Jami. You didn't, but I don't think they feed the dogs very well. They close the door behind them as the dog's growl and yelp and the fighting reaches fever pitch. The sound of flesh and material tearing and wet splatters as the door is shut. Hammer in one hand, and torch in the other, Erik heads off into the darkness, with Jami at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolland stares at Dan and Abel.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Mr. Stitch, have you ever considered just how clever these humans are. Dan and Abel crouch on the floor near the fire place. Rolland admires the .45 on the table picking it up.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Imagine If Alexander the Great had possessed such toys, how long would it have been before the entire world fell at his feet? Could you imagine? Rolland sits in a chair, crossing his legs under him.  75.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: But then again. What he lacked in modern toys, he more than made up for with an unstoppable army. This city is about to witness Rolland Marmerchant's unstoppable army. And as it rolls across this retched land there will be nowhere to run. He leans back, and looks from Dan to Abel. He stares at Abel's grimy white collar.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: So, we have a priest. You won't be the first to join us, I promise you. Nor the last. Rolland's gaze turns to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Where is my wife!?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The woman he took from me. Dan motions in Stitch's direction.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: You risked your life for a woman? Fascinating. Rolland stares at Dan harder. Dan tries to look away, but cant.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: I have existed in the world long enough to forget such things as love. Mr Stitch do you know who he is referring to? Is she here?

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Yes Master. Upstairs, still sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Then bring her down here! And find Hagen as well. He's taken too long.  76. Stitch nods and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Both of you have shown great courage today. You will make worthy additions to my army. He looks toward Abel.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: And you, preacher man, I'll show you just how much power a real God has. Abel lifts his head, locking eyes with Rolland. Rolland laughs out loud, letting his fangs slide out.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: What were you planning to do? We have been around before your God ever existed. No man, no one, no thing can kill me! Abel glares back at him, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You are an arrogant fool. In one sweeping motion he leaps from his chair and lands right next to Abel. One hand grips around his face, finger nails break his skin.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: With one hand I could twist the head from your body, so be very careful indeed! Rolland's fingers tighten. Abel doesn't stop staring at Rolland. Rolland loosens his grip and steps back. Dan crawls over to Abel to check on him. The council chamber door bursts open as Erik is pushed through with Jami following as they stagger through. Stitch brings in Kyeema and closes the door behind him.  77.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: I found these two in the factory. They must have killed Hagen, the woman had this. Stitch throws the large staff Hagen used to work the dogs with into the centre of the room

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: The man was carrying a pack full of stakes, a hammer. The whole kit. Rolland looks intensely at Erik. Dan slowly rises from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Kyeema? She looks at him with frightened eyes and takes a step back. Stitch grabs her neck and forces her to look at Dan, as she struggles to look away from him.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: There's your lover. Like what you see? Can you see the veins running through his body? That's life, your life from now on.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! Dan tries to move over toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Sit down. Dan's legs go dead and he drops instantly to the floor. Erik notices Abel on the floor. Rolland gets out of his seat and goes to Erik with great interest.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: You know our kind, don't you? I see it in your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I know you well.  78.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: How is that?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: My wife was turned by one of you.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Your wife. And yet here you stand. I'm assuming you killed her then. Did you cut her head off? Or did you burn her to death, maybe? Erik tries not to look him in the eyes, but he can't stop.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: So, here you are. Ready to do it again. I wonder if you will be as lucky tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Why here? Why this city?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Why? We no longer need you. Make no mistake, this isn't a random event. If you knew how long this has taken. Not just this city or this country. Every city. Every country. Rolland paces around the room, the conversation excites him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: By now we will have control of Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. Brisbane is falling as I speak. The true dominant species will soon rule the whole planet. Natural order, balance will be restored, no longer will we hide like animals.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You need our blood to survive. Do Dan stands Dan lunges

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: we? and looks at Kyeema, then back at Rolland. for the .45 on the table. As his hand closes on the gun, Rolland lunges at him, knocking him on his back.  79. Rolland stands over him. Dan aims upward and fires twice, one goes through Rolland's throat and strikes the wall behind him, the second passes through his stomach. Rolland picks Dan up by the throat, fingers breaking through the flesh as he squeezes. He tosses him across the room to the feet of Stitch.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: He's all yours. Stitch's eyes light up, and he kicks Dan square in his chest. The crack of bones as he slides across the room and he crashes through chairs, and slams into a solid wall. Stitch strides up to him, removes his gun from his jacket, and grins widely as he shoots Dan in the head three times. Kyeema screams and sinks to her knees. Rolland sweeps over to Abel and yanks him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: You! I am going to enjoy turning you! Someone knocks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Enter! A YOUNG BOY with blonde hair enters and eyes the damage.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: The trucks, Master. They're ready and loaded.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Excellent. Go. The boy looks at Dan's dead body, and hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: Some of the others are talking, Master. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say Hagen has been killed, and we have infiltrated by humans.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Tell them not to fear. As you yourself can see, the humans are in my possession. Tonight the city falls. Now go. He waits until the young vampire has left and turns to his victims and flashes a sick smile.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: You'll be stopped.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: By you and your god? By them? By the dead man on the floor? Tomorrow night you will have forgotten everything and everyone. He looks toward Stitch.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: The priest is mine. You and the female can have those two. When you're finished, take that dead filth and feed him to the dogs. Rolland drags Abel across the room and throws him through the open door into RollandвЂ™s private quarters. Rolland quickly follows, the door slams after him. Stitch slides his gun back into his jacket and sings.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Nowhere to run baby. Nowhere to hide. Erik and Jami back up slowly, and step through a puddle of blood that seeps from Dan's head.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: You! Kyeema! You can have the woman. I'm taking the old man. Erik stumbles over the remains of a broken chair. He wrenches a leg off -- he now had a two-foot club, with a deadly-looking splintered end. Kyeema slowly walks toward the body of Dan, bends down and touches his face, then touches the blood on the floor.  81. She licks her fingers, shakes her head and lets out an ear-piercing scream. Stitch looks around in surprise as Erik plunges the jagged end of the chair leg toward his heart. It strikes, but is deflected by the gun in his jacket. Stitch pulls the chair leg out of his chest.

dialogues.speaker: STITCH
dialogues.text: Close. But close doesn't really cut it here. In a move almost too quick to see, Erik's head is thrust back and throat exposed. Jami grabs his Market and tries to pull him off Erik but Stitch just swats her to the floor. Stitch's fangs slide out, suddenly from behind Kyeema grabs Stitch, her fingernails dig deep into his face and she rips away flesh. Stitch throws himself backwards and tries to get Kyeema off his back. They Roll all over the floor. Erik jumps to his feet as Kyeema plunges her fingers in Stitch's eye sockets. Both eye balls burst. Black liquid leaks down his cheeks, and he howls and twists in agony. He gets a grip on Kyeema and they thrash maniacally around on the floor and into the mouth of the raging --

dialogues.speaker: FIREPLACE
dialogues.text: Flames engulf them, and they quickly combust into hot ash. In the --

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE QUARTERS
dialogues.text: -- Rolland has Abel thrust up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Oh priest. Tonight my army marches the streets as your kind hides in holes. The human race has had its time. Tonight will be humanityвЂ™s last breath.  82. Abel tries to laugh in his face, but can only manage a pathetic gurgle as Rolland chokes him. Abel grabs at Rolland's hands, and tries to get a breath. Rolland's grip loosens ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: All I have heard tonight are the ramblings of a madman, not a great leader. Rolland laughs and drops Abel to the floor. He enjoys watching him gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Priest, I really don't know how to tell you this. But, it's already happened. Abel's stare is cold like ice.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Your city. Nay, your COUNTRY has fallen to creatures like me. Abel leaps to his feet, plunges his hands into his pockets, and pulls out his brass-knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: I respect you for trying, but maybe I hit you too hard earlier. You're failing to comprehend the basic facts. You. Have. Lost. Rolland waits for some sort of reaction from him.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLAND
dialogues.text: Everyone one you know and love will be like me by dawn. Have you got it in you to kill every single one of them, Priest? Erik and Jami burst through the door, ragged splinters of wood in hand. They both rush toward Rolland, screaming bloody murder. Rolland turns to face them, his fangs bared. Abel launches himself at the back of Rolland. His left arm hooks around his neck as he delivers some huge body blows with his right.  83. A shocked Rolland flails for Abel as Erik plunges his stake through his right shoulder. Rolland backhands Erik with his right hand and sends him reeling across the room. Rolland struggles to pull the steak out of his shoulder. Abel still hangs on for dear life and tries to push the steak deeper into his shoulder. Jami's attack happens straight after Erik's, Rolland thrashes around so much it is hard for her to get a clear shot. She lunges at him and strikes just below his heart. Rolland roars in pain as he pulls the new steak out quickly. Abel tightens his grip and uses the distraction to get him off balance and manages to get him off centre and tip him backwards. As he feels Rolland stagger, Abel puts every last ounce of strength he has left to get him onto the ground. Rolland hits the floor with a loud crack as his skull bounces on the floor. Abel, as nimble as a cat, does not waste a second, and lands punch after punch into his face. Erik holds Rolland's feet as Jami grabs her stake which Rolland discarded. This time her aim is true as she drives the stake clean through his evil heart. Rolland goes limp and quiet for a brief moment, starts to choke and goes into seizure. Jami and Erik back way the hell off. Abel stands over him, he watches him twitch and shake with cold angry eyes. Abel raises a massive boot and stamps the stake all the way home! Rolland instantly stops moving and withers to a husk.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: Jesus!  84.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I couldnвЂ™t agree more.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Depends on what you mean by okay. Abel looks towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: How does it look? Can we get out of here now?

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: We are clear to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor is filled with screams. Vampires come out of the darkness and bump into them, then race away in a panicked frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: VAMPIRE PUNK
dialogues.text: The master has fallen!

dialogues.speaker: VAMPIRE HOOKER
dialogues.text: The humans killed the master! A few vampires start toward the group but stop and sniff the blood of Rolland on Abel's hands. A total look of fear washes all over them and they flee from the slayer. The dogs bay behind the shut door. The group retrace their steps to where they come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires run across the courtyard with dazed looks across their faces, some of them walk with their arms outstretched and scream for their master. Walter, arms full of books, closely watches Jami exit in all the mayhem. Erik hauls the gate up and ties it off. They run up the -  85.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: -- and sprint for the Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Get in! Everyone piles into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key is still inside the ignition, and they tear off. The night is still, apart from the odd wail of a distant vampire. Everyone is subdued in the car ride.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: This hasn't finished.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: I'd give it a few days before they realize what has happened here.

dialogues.speaker: JAMI
dialogues.text: We stopped him, didn't we? We rout the rest before they get organized and we finish them.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: What then? There are only three of uS...

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: We can't be the only survivors. There has got to be others? We'll find them. Make a stand. Abel seems lost in his own thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: We'll need supplies.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: I know exactly where to go. Erik nods and looks out over the city as they race by... Amongst the surrounding bushes, nothing but RED EYES await an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles as a headless chickens runs around without direction.  86. Several vampires hover around their motorbikes and he shouts out at them.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Saddle up! They turn and stare back at him. Walter's receptionist Sally appears, and seductively wraps an arm around his waist. Walter grins. The bikers still seem a tad unsure what to do. Walter exposes his fangs and increases in volume.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I said. Saddle the fuck up! They all look to each-other nervously. One by one they climb on to their bikes and do as commanded. Sally gets on the back of Walter's bike. Walter fires up his Hog, the rest do the same.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER 1
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm the body snatcher. Lets ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mass of headlights pour out from warehouses throughout the city, forming a massive group. FADE TO BLACK.
